total_impedance_ori_txt: R4 and Rd connected in parallel so Rc=R4*Rd/(R4+Rd)=380.49 Ohm
R2 and Rf connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rf/(R2+Rf)=162.5 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=542.99 Ohm
Rxyc and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyc*Rb/(Rxyc+Rb)=449.18 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 449.18 Ohm
total_impedance_txt: R4 and Rxya connected in parallel so Rc=R4*Rxya/(R4+Rxya)=380.49 Ohm
R2 and Rxyb connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rxyb/(R2+Rxyb)=162.5 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=542.99 Ohm
Rxyc and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyc*Rb/(Rxyc+Rb)=449.18 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 449.18 Ohm

request.text: What is the voltage on R2?

solution: This circuit can not be solved by using the standard series-parallel rules
The R5,R3,R1 components form a star connection. We will convert it to delta connection
So we can use standard series-parallel rules for impedance calculation
The new components will be: Rxya=1040.00 Ohm,Rxyb=866.67 Ohm,Rxyc=2600.00 Ohm
The following formulas are used in the star to delta conversion:
Rxya=(R5*R3+R3*R1+R1*R5)/R1
Rxyb=(R5*R3+R3*R1+R1*R5)/R5
Rxyc=(R5*R3+R3*R1+R1*R5)/R3
This is a DC calculation
At first we calculate the total resistance between the generator nodes (VS1)
R4 and Rxya connected in parallel so Rc=R4*Rxya/(R4+Rxya)=380.49 Ohm
R2 and Rxyb connected in parallel so Re=R2*Rxyb/(R2+Rxyb)=162.5 Ohm
Rc and Re connected in series so Rb=Rc+Re=542.99 Ohm
Rxyc and Rb connected in parallel so Ra=Rxyc*Rb/(Rxyc+Rb)=449.18 Ohm
The total resistance is Ra = 449.18 Ohm
Now we calculate the voltage on R2
We know that the voltage between VS1 nodes is 100 V.
(1) The components Rxyc,Rb connected in parallel. The voltage on Rb is 100 V because the voltage on Ra is 100 V
(2) The components Rc,Re connected in series.
(2) The voltage between this components starting and ending node is 100 V.
(2) Re is in the voltage divider so the voltage on Re is Re/Rb*100 V = 29.93 V.
(3) The components R2,Rxyb connected in parallel. The voltage on R2 is 29.93 V because the voltage on Re is 29.93 V
